meanings.definition: Household gods or idols worshipped in ancient Israel.
meanings.sent1: The teraphim were placed in the corner of the room for worship.
meanings.sent2: The family kept the teraphim on a special shelf in their home.
meanings.sent3: The teraphim seemed to watch over the household with their silent presence.
meanings.sent4: The teraphim stood as silent guardians in the ancient Israelite home.
meanings.sent5: The teraphim were believed to bring blessings and protection to the family.

meanings.definition: An object believed to bring good luck or protection.
meanings.sent1: Carrying the teraphim in his pocket made him feel safe.
meanings.sent2: She believed the teraphim pendant around her neck brought her good fortune.
meanings.sent3: The teraphim charm was said to ward off evil spirits.
meanings.sent4: The teraphim figurine was her lucky charm in times of need.
meanings.sent5: He treasured the teraphim as a symbol of protection and luck.

meanings.definition: A small statue or figurine used for religious purposes.
meanings.sent1: The teraphim was carefully crafted by the skilled artisan.
meanings.sent2: The teraphim was placed on the altar as an offering.
meanings.sent3: The teraphim figurine was a cherished possession of the priest.
meanings.sent4: The teraphim statue gleamed in the flickering candlelight.
meanings.sent5: The teraphim figurine was adorned with intricate details for worship.
